alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 3:47AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington Iowa, affecting all counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lock and Dam 18 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM CDT Thursday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 13.6 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
